name: Pillars Fund
mission: Pillars Fund amplifies the leadership, narratives, and talents of Muslims in the United States to advance opportunity and justice for all.
theoryOfChange: Focused on narrative and cultural power—tapping into a rich inheritance of Muslim storytelling to help transform society; the Pillars Artist Fellowship seeks to empower creatives to tell their own stories that reflect the full complexity and richness of their experiences.

strengths_deep_dive: Pillars Fund excels in its role as a specialized grantmaker, focusing on high-impact domestic distributions. Their 2023 tax filings reveal a commitment to local leadership, with top grants including <cite id="12">$155,000 to the Inner City Muslim Action Network</cite> and <cite id="13">$145,000 to Detroit Revival Engaging Muslims</cite>. Beyond financial support, their fellowship model provides tangible outcomes for creators, such as supporting a <cite id="14">cohort of 6 fellows</cite> who contributed <cite id="15">6 multimedia contributions</cite> to the cultural landscape. This dual approach of institutional grantmaking and individual talent development allows them to influence narrative change at multiple levels of society.
rich_narrative.summary: Pillars Fund is a strategic grantmaking organization dedicated to <cite id="1">amplifying the talents of American Muslims</cite> and reshaping national narratives through leadership and storytelling. Operating as a <cite id="2">philanthropic partner for Muslim creators</cite>, the organization reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $2,398,957</cite> in the 2023 fiscal year. Their model focuses on <cite id="4">investing in nonprofit organizations</cite> and individual fellows who challenge stereotypes and build community power. Pillars Fund has demonstrated significant financial scale, having <cite id="5">invested and leveraged $30 million</cite> to date to support its mission. The organization's work is divided into key pillars, including <cite id="6">Storytelling Grants and the Pillars Artist Fellowship</cite>, which provide direct support to Muslim artists and media professionals. Despite a <cite id="7">3-year revenue CAGR of -53.4%</cite>, the organization maintains a <cite id="8">program expense ratio of 74.3%</cite>, indicating that the vast majority of its current spending is directed toward its core grantmaking and fellowship activities. By focusing on <cite id="9">capacity building and narrative change</cite>, Pillars Fund serves as a critical bridge between the American Muslim community and the broader media and philanthropic landscapes.
